intro: Nogalia drepanophylla subsp. suaediformis, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing, herbaceous perennial that produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xeriscaping and ecological restoration in desert landscapes.
